attributes.action: Repeal the Payment of Wages Act 1991
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Payment of Wages Act 1991 repealed the Truck Act of 1831-1896.
It was alleged by the then government that workers wages were safer being paid by cheque or into a bank account, rather than in 'Coin of the Realm'.
Since that date the majority of workers have been forced, to suit employers and banks, to have there wages paid directly into a bank. 
This also applies to pensions and those on benefits.
It now apears certain that, despite recording billions of pounds in profits, banks are to impose charges on bank accounts.
This appears to be an indirect imposition of the 'Truck'.
With the repeal of the Payment of Wages Act 1991 all persons, so inclined, will be able to have wages, pensions and benefits paid, again, in 'Coin of the Realm'.
This will also allow all to make an informed decison on whether they wish to hold bank accounts.
